rev.comment: Is this relevant in any way? (sorry, but I honestly don't understand what that is suppose to mean)
rev.diff:
Line 32: Line 32:
Recently the ISP hosting openbittorrent has been ordered to hand over the identity of openbittorrent operators to hollywood movie companies or face a hefty fine of SEK 500,000 ($63,633)<ref>[http://torrentfreak.com/isp-must-hand-over-identity-of-openbittorrent-operator-100519/ ISP Must Hand Over Identity Of OpenBitTorrent Operator]</ref>, the site as well as the tracker has been taken offline since then.
Recently the ISP hosting openbittorrent has been ordered to hand over the identity of openbittorrent operators to hollywood movie companies or face a hefty fine of SEK 500,000 ($63,633)<ref>[http://torrentfreak.com/isp-must-hand-over-identity-of-openbittorrent-operator-100519/ ISP Must Hand Over Identity Of OpenBitTorrent Operator]</ref>, the site as well as the tracker has been taken offline since then.
â   â
As of May 26, 2010, openbittorrent has replaced their DNS records with bogus entries. openbittorrent.com now points to 127.0.0.1, which is the loopback address. Rather than removing their DNS records, The Pirate Bay pulled this same maneuver when its trackers were taken down.
